Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to look through each case and identify which activities occur multiple times.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case C001: - Initiate Request (once) - Verify Documents (twice) - Call Customer (once) - Submit Additional (once) - Approve Request (once). So Verify Documents is repeated here. The first Verify Documents is when the agent checks identity docs, but then after the customer submits additional info, they Verify Documents again. The context here is different: initial check vs. re-check after getting missing documents.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In C003, the first Verify is physical verification at the branch, then after Adjust Account, they re-verify. So here, the first is in-person, maybe 'In-Person Document Verification' and the second could be 'Post-Adjustment Document Recheck'.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then in Call Customer in C002: first call is to clarify discrepancy, the second is follow-up confirmation. So first could be 'Clarification Call' and the second 'Follow-Up Confirmation Call'.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: For Verify Documents in C001: First occurrence: Agent checks identity documents. The context is initial verification. The second Verify Documents in C001 is after the customer submits additional info, so it's a re-check. So we can rename the first to 'Initial Document Verification' and the second to 'Recheck Documents After Submission' or something similar.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: In C002's calls, the first is to clarify discrepancy, second is confirmation, so different purposes.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: In C003, first Verify is physical (branch officer), second is after account adjustment, hence renaming to in-person and post-adjustment.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Another activity to check is Adjust Account. In C002, Adjust Account is after a call to clarify discrepancy, and in C003 it's due to missing info. But Adjust Account occurs once per case, so maybe no need to rename unless same name is used for different contexts across cases, but the problem says focus on same case. So maybe not an issue here.
